intro: Adenosma debilis, commonly known as the slender adenosma, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories or wetlands. Its small, white or yellowish flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and it has thin, fibrous roots. Adenosma debilis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
